reviews.review_msg: Hadia is very nice, passionate and approachable. However, it feels like she needs a bit more experience with teaching, to give better feedback to assignments. The lectures are mostly group facilitated discussions, there's  also reflective journals and final group project. She gives very good career advice and actually cares about students futures.

Hadia is one of the most warm & caring teachers I've had at SFU, she genuinely cares about student success & gives students guidance on the real world after graduation. Not many profs do this or care about their students, but Hadia was so wonderful & inspirational. I would 100% take another course with her!

Hadia is so sweet, knowledgeable and passionate about global health. Would definitely recommend taking this course with her. Mostly group work (presentation and final project) and 2 easy journal entries. She gives great feedback and career advice and has some interesting guest lecturers. Most lectures are facilitated dialogues.

Doesn't grade anything all semester, which is really frustrating, and often goes on about personal beliefs instead of class material in the seminars. I'd recommend only taking this class if it's necessary.

Kate is a good person, but not a good prof. Took weeks to upload the syllabus yet changes it throughout the semester. Unclear guidelines. Hasn't marked a single thing this whole semester so i dont even know what grade i'm getting, and takes forever to reply to emails. Goes on tangents during class and her lectures are long and not very engaging.

She's a good prof, but takes her sweet time marking things. We were graded on an individual paper, group project , online discussions , a presentation (10%) and completion of online courses . We did nothing for pre much the whole semester and the last two weeks were just deadlines on deadlines.

Her seminar on Global Health: Capacity for Global Health Workforce was simply one of the best courses and seminars I have taken throughout my undergraduate career. She is really friendly to approach and cares about the students as well as her course objectives.
